title: Paul the Apostle
summary: Paul the Apostle[note 1][8] (c. 5 – c. 64/67 AD), commonly known as Saint Paul and also known by his Hebrew name Saul of Tarsus,[note 2][9] was a Christian apostle (although not one of the Twelve Apostles) who spread the teachings of Jesus in the first-century world.[10] Generally regarded as one of the most important figures of the Apostolic Age,[9][11] he founded several Christian communities in Asia Minor and Europe from the mid-30s to the mid-50s AD.[12]
